intro: Gymnostoma intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate gymnostoma, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with five petals. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with specific ecological requirements.
